original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields down at open, rupee at 321.50/90 against the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were slightly down at open on Tuesday and the rupee opened at 321.50/90 against the US dollar, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 27.90/28.10 percent, down from 28.00/30 percent on Monday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 26.90/27.10 percent, down from 27.00/10 percent.
The rupee opened at 321.50/90 to the US dollar in the spot market unchanged from the last close (Colombo/April24/2023)
